did.unittitle: American Society of Church History records

bioghist.p: Founded in 1888, the American Society of Church History (ASCH) is dedicated to the scholarly study of the history of Christianity and its relationship to surrounding cultures in all periods, locations and contexts. The Society aims to promote and stimulate the historical study of the Christian church and faith, its figures and movements, in institutional and non-institutional settings.

scopecontent.p: This collection includes correspondence, minutes, lists of registrants, programs, and reports related to annual American Society of Church History meetings between 1942-1978, 1980-84, and 1994-2000; correspondence and related materials for a Centennial volume and special issue of Church History; minutes, memoranda, correspondence, and reports of the Centennial Planning Committee, 1979-1988; applications for the Philip Schaff Centennial Award for Younger Scholars, 1985, which include resumes, letters of references, and proposals; materials related to annual meetings, 1985-1989; bound volumes of papers of the American Society of Church History, 1908-1934, and a program for the ASCH winter meeting in Seattle, January 2005. Other materials include a 1997 Johns Hopkins University Press publishing proposal; correspondence related to setting up editorial offices at Duke University, an autobiographical sketch by Winthrop S. Hudson; and a copy of Henry W. Bowden, ed., A Century of Church History: The Legacy of Philip Schaff (Carbondale and Edwardsville, IL: Southern Illinois University Press, 1988).
